snippet: As early as this week, the prime minister of Britain and the first minister of Scotland will hold face-to-face meetings on granting Scotland greater autonomy.
abstract: Memo from Glasgow; British Prime Min David Cameron and Scottish National Party leader Nicola Sturgeon will meet to discuss additional autonomy for Scotland following election in which Scottish separatists won 56 of Scotland's 59 parliamentary seats, nearly ousting unionist lawmakers; results raise possibility of second referendum on independence, making talks particularly important.
lead_paragraph: As early as this week, the prime minister of Britain and the first minister of Scotland will hold face-to-face meetings on granting Scotland greater autonomy.

headline.main: A Chasm Divides David Cameron and Nicola Sturgeon, Leaders of a Kingdom Still United
headline.print_headline: A Chasm Divides Leaders of a Kingdom Still United
